item.title: Shawn Catudal
item.description: Shawn is currently a Junior Electrical Engineering student who grew up in Berlin, Germany. He is passionate about innovation, robotics, as well as basically any type of new and groundbreaking technology. He is currently working on the digital open source ion channel amplifier project and is focussing on analog circuit design. When he is not working diligently on this or his academics, Shawn enjoys playing ice hockey and brainstorming startup ideas with his roommates.

item.title: Ian Bonequi Delgadillo
item.description: Ian is a second-year student at St. Thomas, currently pursuing a degree in Electrical Engineering. His current responsibility is developing Verilog code for the COVG amplifier project. He is coding modules that will connect to a host computer using the Opal Kelly Front Panel interface, which allow the host computer to control analog to digital and digital to analog converters, through the use of an SPI interface and a Wishbone bus.

item.title: Lexi Serreyn
item.description: Lexi is an Electrical Engineering and Physics double major from East Bethel, MN, graduating in spring of 2022. She is interested in the intersections between Optics and Electrical Engineering, specifically medical imaging solutions. In the research lab she crafted a new slope calculation algorithm to account for various noise types in photodiode readings in a point of care imaging device.

item.title: William Schneider
item.description: Will, a sophomore from a small town in central Minnesota, is studying mechanical engineering and researching the electrical properties of conductive filaments for 3D printers. His primary interest is horology, but he also finds 3D printers, RC systems, and high powered rockets interesting. He codes well (even in C++)!

item.title: Matthew Schewe
item.description: Matthew was a UST Electrical Engineering Major who graduated in the Spring of 2020. He worked on electronics for a new ion-channel amplifier. He is a multisim expert and finished an entire PCB design cycle in the summer of 2019.

item.title: Mohamed Abdalla
item.description: Mohamed is a UST Master’s student in the graduate programs in software. He is working on an independent study project to develop inexpensive methods to calibrate and evaluate accelerometers and gyroscopes (IMUs).

item.title: Ryan Jans
item.description: Ryan graduated from UST with an Electrical Engineering Major in the spring of 2020. He did excellent work on optical time-of-flight depth sensors and was the first undergraduate to be the first author on a reviewed journal paper in our lab Characterization of a Miniaturized IR Depth Sensor With a Programmable Region-of-Interest That Enables Hazard Mapping Applications. He also worked on an industry linked RF communications project. Ryan is now a graduate student at the Air Force Institute of Technology in Ohio.

item.title: Phillip Kuplic
item.description: Phil is a UST Mechanical Engineering Major who graduated in the Spring of 2020. He constructed an apparatus for characterizing LED illumination systems for microscope and spectrophotometer applications. He presented his work on LED characterization at the APS March meeting in Boston in 2019.

item.title: Savannah Johnson
item.description: Savannah graduated in the Spring of 2020 with a major in Mechanical Engineering and minors in Electrical Engineering and Aerospace Studies. Along the way she won 3 national awards as a ROTC cadet She is curious about the real-world applications of physics and mathematics. Electronics, control systems, automation, and transportation systems spark her interest.

item.title: Lucas Manke
item.description: Lucas graduated in the Spring of 2020 and was a senior majoring in Mechanical Engineering and pursuing minors in Business Administration and Military Science. He was a member of the varsity swim team at UST and a cadet in Army ROTC at the University of Minnesota.

item.title: Xiaokang Li
item.description: Xiaokang completed an electrical engineering Master’s degree at the University of St. Thomas.
